definition: to make a living
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
no way to get by

sentences.chinese: 吉姆靠给人擦皮鞋为生。

sentences.english: Its only inhabitants were a few hunting and fishing tribes.
sentences.chinese: 当地唯一的住户是几个以打猎和捕鱼为生的部落。

sentences.english: Polar bears depend on solid sea ice for survival; it's where they do their hunting.
sentences.chinese: 北极熊在厚厚的海洋冰层上猎食，以此为生。

sentences.english: The poor have to struggle for a living.
sentences.chinese: 他很穷，穷得几乎无以为生。

sentences.english: The girl with shapely body scraped a living by selling crapes .
sentences.chinese: 那个体态优美的女孩子靠卖黑纱为生。

sentences.english: Vice Snr-Gen Maung is a real soldier and a battle-oriented person.
sentences.chinese: 孟诶副大将是一个真正的军人，以战场为生。

sentences.english: Poverty reduced them to begging for a living.
sentences.chinese: 贫困迫使他们乞讨为生。

sentences.english: They lived by hunting and by gathering roots nuts, and wild fruits.
sentences.chinese: 他们靠打猎和收集树根果仁和野果为生。

sentences.english: Primitive tribes lived by fishing, hunting and gathering.
sentences.chinese: 原始部落靠渔猎采集为生。

sentences.english: Then he quitted the official position and restarted a fisherman's family life.
sentences.chinese: 于是，他辞去了官职，重新过起捕鱼为生的渔家生活。

sentences.english: In a saprophytic chain, microorganisms live on dead organic matter.
sentences.chinese: 在腐生链中，微生物以死的有机物质为生。

sentences.english: I never thought he would come down to begging.
sentences.chinese: 我怎么也想不到他会沦落到乞讨为生。

sentences.english: Living on selling benne, he led a hard and poor life.
sentences.chinese: 他靠卖胡麻为生，日子过得很清苦。

sentences.english: It trains fishermen who usually earn a living fishing in the ocean to be fish farmers.
sentences.chinese: 列车渔民的收入一般在海洋捕鱼为生的养鱼户。

sentences.english: She is a vegetarian, so she lives mainly on vegetable and fruit.
sentences.chinese: 她是素食主义者，所以主要靠吃蔬菜和水果为生。

definition: to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
abbr. for 維持生活|维持生活[wei2 chi2 sheng1 huo2]
to live one's life/to make a living
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
farming/to work the land
to farm/to work the land
no way to get by
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
to glean/to collect scraps/to eke out a meager living
to fish
livelihood
